SENT.plain: A 10-year-old male with severe aplastic anemia following allogeneic BMT developed a hemolytic crisis on post-BMT day 67
The diagnosis of cold hemagglutinin disease was made based on the findings of anemia, reticulocytosis, positive direct Coombs test, and markedly elevated cold agglutinins
Anti-nuclear antibody and anti-DNA antibody were also increased
Plasmapheresis was effective as an emergency measure
Corticosteroid after plasmapheresis had a transient effect
At the second episode of hemolysis 6 months after BMT, immunosuppressive therapy with cyclophosphamide plus corticosteroid was successfully administered without negative effect on engraftment
